I don't see the relationship to Mito.  It rather resembles Umetada (later) Tadatsugu group.  The flash is way too hot to say much about the patina.  It's probably reddish brown under a reasonable exposure.

Jim



  Here is something that may interest some. Recently I had an online 
  discussion about Mito Tsuba. This tsuba's image was sent to me as an 
  example of Mito. Apparently there is some discussion going on about 
  it's age. Mr Robert Haynes has put back the date by 100 years. That 
  isn't what I wonder about. It is the patina and colour. Has anyone 
  seen this type of patina before? John

    http://ph.groups.yahoo.com/group/nihontostudy/photos/view/d020?b=4
